```{r include = TRUE, results = "asis"}
# Create the data frame with the necessary columns
new_table <- data.frame(
  Citation = character(),
  Study_Design = character(),
  Population = character(),
  Questions = character(),
  Variables = character(),
  data_analysis = character(),
  results = character(),
  review = character(),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

# Example entry for manual filling (you will need to fill these with the actual data)
new_table[1, ] <- c(
  "Beilock et al. (2007)",
  "Experimental",
  "100 college students, mixed gender",
  "Behavioral tasks, fMRI",
  "Stereotype threat impairs working memory efficiency",
  "Prefrontal cortex, phonological loop",
  "Reduced performance on cognitive tasks under threat",
  "yes"
)

# Create the apa_table object
apa_table(
  new_table,
  caption = "Overview of the Included Papers for Hypothesis 1",
  longtable = TRUE,
  escape = FALSE,
  landscape = TRUE,
  col.names = c(
    "Citation",
    "Study Design",
    "Population",
    "Research Questions",
    "Variables",
    "Methods of Data Analysis",
    "Results",
    "Hypothesis confirmed"
  ),
  align = c("m{1.5cm}", "m{3cm}", "m{2.5cm}", "m{3cm}", "m{3cm}", "m{3cm}", "m{3.5cm}", "m{1.5cm}"),
  note = "Note: Some column headers span multiple lines for better readability."
)
```
